Basic details: Emily Johnson, a 2-year-old girl, is brought to the clinic by her parents due to persistent noisy breathing.
Vitals:
BP: 90/60 mm Hg
Temp: 99.1°F (37.3°C)
RR: 30/minute
HR: 110/minute, regular
Physical presentation: Sit on the examination table and exhibit noisy breathing sounds, particularly during inhalation. Show signs of mild distress and tugging at the neck. If asked about previous episodes, look towards your parents for answers.
Challenging question: "Is my daughter going to have trouble breathing forever?"
